tags.name: DomainManagerBackups
tags.description: Provides an ability to backup and restore the Domain Manager. Backup can be configured to  cluster or s3 compatible objectstore.

get.description: Lists backup targets (cluster or object store) configured for a given domain manager.

parameters.name: domainManagerExtId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the domain manager.

200.description: Returns a list of backup clusters/object store backing up the domain manager.

x-permissions.description: Allows to list backup targets of the Prism Central

post.description:
Creates a cluster or object store as the backup target. For a given Prism Central,
there can be up to 3 clusters as backup targets 
and 1 object store as backup target. If any cluster or object store is not eligible for backup or 
lacks appropriate permissions, the API request will fail. 
For object store backup targets, specifying backup policy is mandatory along 
with the location of the object store.

parameters.name: domainManagerExtId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the domain manager.

202.description: Returns the task ID corresponding to the create backup target request.

schema.description: Indicates the target of a redirection or the URL of a newly created resource.

x-permissions.description: Allows to create a backup target for the Prism Central

x-required-headers.name: NTNX-Request-Id
x-required-headers.description: A unique identifier that is associated with each request. The provided value must be opaque and preferably in Universal Unique Identifier (UUID) format. This identifier is also used as an idempotence token for safely retrying requests in case of network errors. All the supported Nutanix API clients add this auto-generated request identifier to each request.

get.description:
Retrieves the backup targets (cluster or object store) from a domain manager and returns the
backup configuration and lastSyncTimestamp parameter to the user.

parameters.name: domainManagerExtId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the domain manager.

parameters.name: extId
parameters.description: A globally unique identifier of an instance that is suitable for external consumption.

200.description: Returns the backup target details corresponding to the cluster/object store configuration.

x-permissions.description: Allows to get a particular backup target

put.description: Updates the credentials and/or RPO of the given object store.

parameters.name: domainManagerExtId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the domain manager.

parameters.name: extId
parameters.description: A globally unique identifier of an instance that is suitable for external consumption.

202.description: Returns the task ID corresponding to the update backup target request.

schema.description: Indicates the target of a redirection or the URL of a newly created resource.

x-permissions.description: Allows to update properties of a backup target such as RPO and credentials

x-required-headers.name: NTNX-Request-Id
x-required-headers.description: A unique identifier that is associated with each request. The provided value must be opaque and preferably in Universal Unique Identifier (UUID) format. This identifier is also used as an idempotence token for safely retrying requests in case of network errors. All the supported Nutanix API clients add this auto-generated request identifier to each request.

delete.description:
Removes cluster/object store from the backup targets. This will stop the cluster/object store 
from backing up Prism Central data.

parameters.name: domainManagerExtId
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the domain manager.

parameters.name: extId
parameters.description: A globally unique identifier of an instance that is suitable for external consumption.

202.description: Returns the task ID corresponding to the delete backup target request.

schema.description: Indicates the target of a redirection or the URL of a newly created resource.

x-permissions.description: Allows to delete a backup target

x-required-headers.name: If-Match
x-required-headers.description: The If-Match request header makes the request conditional. When not provided the server will respond with an HTTP 428 (Precondition Required) response code indicating that the server requires the request to be conditional. The server will allow successful completion of PUT and PATCH operations, if the resource matches the ETag value returned to the response of a GET operation. If the conditional does not match, then an HTTP 412 (Precondition Failed) response

x-required-headers.name: NTNX-Request-Id
x-required-headers.description: A unique identifier that is associated with each request. The provided value must be opaque and preferably in Universal Unique Identifier (UUID) format. This identifier is also used as an idempotence token for safely retrying requests in case of network errors. All the supported Nutanix API clients add this auto-generated request identifier to each request.

prism.v4.r0.management.BackupTarget.description: The backup target for the domain manager, which can be either a cluster or an object store.

location.description: Location of the backup target. For example, a cluster or an object store endpoint, such as AWS s3.

lastSyncTime.description:
Represents the time when the domain manager was last synchronized or copied its 
configuration data to the backup target. This field is updated every 30 minutes.

isBackupPaused.description: Whether the backup is paused on the given cluster or not.

backupPauseReason.description: Specifies a reason why the backup might have paused. This will be empty if the isBackupPaused field is false.

prism.v4.r0.management.ClusterLocation.description: Model which contains the information of backup cluster.

prism.v4.r0.management.ObjectStoreLocati.description:
Model which contains the information of the object store endpoint where 
backup is present. It contains information like objectstore 
endpoint address, endpoint flavour and last sync timestamp.

bucketName.description:
The bucket name of the object store endpoint where backup data of domain manager
is to be stored.

region.description:
The region name of the object store endpoint where backup data of domain manager
is stored.

prism.v4.r0.management.S3Config.description: The endpoint of the object store s3 where domain manager is backed up.

prism.v4.r0.management.AWSS3Config.description: The base model of S3 object store endpoint where domain manager is backed up.

credentials.description: This object is a container for credentials to access the objectstore

accessKeyId.description: Access key Id for the object store provided for backup target.

secretAccessKey.description: Secret access key for the object store provided for backup target.

prism.v4.r0.management.AccessKeyCredenti.description: Secret credentials model for the object store containing access key ID and secret access key.

rpoInMinutes.description: RPO interval in minutes at which the backup will be taken

prism.v4.r0.management.BackupPolicy.description: Backup policy for the object store provided.

prism.v4.r0.error.ErrorResponse.description: An error response indicates that the operation has failed either due to a client error(4XX) or server error(5XX). Please look at the HTTP status code and namespace specific error code and error message for further details.

code.description: The code associated with this message.This string is typically prefixed by the namespace the endpoint belongs to. For example: VMM-40000

locale.description: Locale for this message. The default locale would be 'en-US'.

errorGroup.description: The error group associated with this message of severity ERROR.

argumentsMap.description: The map of argument name to value.

prism.v4.r0.error.AppMessage.description: Message with associated severity describing status of the current operation.

statusCode.description: The HTTP status code of the response.

error.description: The generic error message for the response.

path.description: API path on which the request was made.

prism.v4.r0.error.SchemaValidationError.description: This schema is generated from SchemaValidationError.java

location.description: The part of the request that failed validation. Validation can fail for path, query parameters, and request body.

message.description: The detailed message for the validation error.

attributePath.description: The path of the attribute that failed validation in the schema.

prism.v4.r0.error.SchemaValidationErrorM.description: This schema is generated from SchemaValidationErrorMessage.java

prism.v4.r0.management.ListBackupTargets.description: REST response for all response codes in API path /prism/v4.0/management/domain-managers/{domainManagerExtId}/backup-targets-new Get operation

prism.v4.r0.management.DeleteBackupTarge.description: REST response for all response codes in API path /prism/v4.0/management/domain-managers/{domainManagerExtId}/backup-targets-new/{extId} Delete operation

prism.v4.r0.management.GetBackupTargetAp.description: REST response for all response codes in API path /prism/v4.0/management/domain-managers/{domainManagerExtId}/backup-targets-new/{extId} Get operation

prism.v4.r0.management.UpdateBackupTarge.description: REST response for all response codes in API path /prism/v4.0/management/domain-managers/{domainManagerExtId}/backup-targets-new/{extId} Put operation

tenantId.description: A globally unique identifier that represents the tenant that owns this entity. The system automatically assigns it, and it and is immutable from an API consumer perspective (some use cases may cause this Id to change - For instance, a use case may require the transfer of ownership of the entity, but these cases are handled automatically on the server).

common.v1.r0.config.TenantAwareModel.description: A model base class whose instances are bound to a specific tenant.  This model adds a tenantId to the base model class that it extends and is automatically set by the server.

code.description: A code that uniquely identifies a message.

locale.description: The locale for the message description.

name.description: The key of the key-value pair.

value.description: The value associated with the key for this key-value pair

oneOf.description: A string value in a key-value pair.
An integer value in a key-value pair.
An boolean value in a key-value pair.
A value in a key-value pair that represents a list of strings.
A value in a key-value pair that represents a map of string keys and values.
A value in a key-value pair that represents an array of maps of string keys and values.
A value in a key-value pair that represents a list of integers.

common.v1.r0.config.KVPair.description: A map describing a set of keys and their corresponding values.

map.description: A map with string keys and values.

common.v1.r0.config.MapOfStringWrapper.description: A wrapper schema containing a map with string keys and values.

common.v1.r0.config.Flag.description: Many entities in the Nutanix APIs carry flags.  This object captures all the flags associated with that entity through this object.  The field that hosts this type of object must have an attribute called x-bounded-map-keys that tells which flags are actually present for that entity.

flags.description: An array of flags that may indicate the status of the response. For example, a flag with the name 'isPaginated' and value 'false', indicates that the response is not paginated.

links.description: An array of HATEOAS style links for the response that may also include pagination links for list operations.

totalAvailableResults.description: The total number of entities that are available on the server for this type.

messages.description: Information, Warning or Error messages that might provide additional contextual information related to the operation.

common.v1.r0.response.ApiResponseMetadat.description: The metadata associated with an API response. This value is always present and minimally contains the self-link for the API request that produced this response. It also contains pagination data for the paginated requests.

href.description: The URL at which the entity described by the link can be accessed.

rel.description: A name that identifies the relationship of the link to the object that is returned by the URL.  The unique value of "self" identifies the URL for the object.

common.v1.r0.response.ApiLink.description: A HATEOAS style link for the response.  Each link contains a user-friendly name identifying the link and an address for retrieving the particular resource.

common.v1.r0.response.ExternalizableAbst.description: A model that represents an object instance that is accessible through an API endpoint.  Instances of this type get an extId field that contains the globally unique identifier for that instance.  Externally accessible instances are always tenant aware and, therefore, extend the TenantAwareModel

extId.description: A globally unique identifier of an instance that is suitable for external consumption.

links.description: A HATEOAS style link for the response.  Each link contains a user-friendly name identifying the link and an address for retrieving the particular resource.

extId.description: Cluster UUID of a remote cluster.

prism.v4.r0.management.ClusterReference.description: Cluster reference of the remote cluster to be connected.

extId.description: A globally unique identifier for a task.

prism.v4.r0.config.TaskReference.description: A reference to a task tracking an asynchronous operation. The status of the task can be queried by making a GET request to the task URI provided in the metadata section of the API response.
